newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-BIERHOFF DOUBTS HE WILL PLAY IN GERMANY AGAIN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-BIERHOFF DOUBTS HE WILL PLAY IN GERMANY AGAIN.

text.p: Udinese's struggling German international striker Oliver Bierhoff said on Saturday he doubted he would play in Germany again because not many clubs wanted him there and life was tough.
"There's a 99 per cent chance I won't return home," he told Italy's Gazzetta dello Sport newspaper.
Bierhoff has not played in Germany since 1990, when he left Borussia Moenchengladbach for Austria's Salzburg. He has been in Italy since 1991, first at Ascoli then Udinese.

"There are not many clubs that want me there and for a national team player life in Germany is not easy. (Juergen) Klinsmann scored 16 league goals and 14 UEFA Cup goals last season and yet now he is being slaughtered," he said.

Germany's 32-year-old captain Klinsmann is giving up a lucrative contract at Bayern Munich at the end of the season because he is unhappy with the atmosphere at the club. He has said he plans to move abroad.
Bierhoff, who scored the two goals in the European championship final last summer to give Germany a 2-1 victory over the Czech Republic, has also suffered recently.

He injured an ankle in Italy on December 1 after scoring twice against Parma and was out until mid-February when he returned against Cagliari. He scored the winner again in that match but the goals have since dried up.
Bierhoff, 28, said he was happy to stay at Udinese. "There's the World Cup next year and playing at Udinese I will be able to make the most of my chances," he said.
